name: Richard Shelby

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text:

https://t.co/rQ0Oa7xGcP

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: My hope is that we can pass this legislation and use the same framework that made this bill possible as we begin the FY23 appropriations process.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Finally, the FY22 package provides critical emergency assistance to our military, Ukraine, and our European allies without reducing base defense spending by a single dollar.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: The FY22 bill also provides an 11% increase over FY21 for the Department of Homeland Security and cuts nearly $65 billion in wasteful non-defense spending proposed in the Biden Administration’s budget – a nearly 10% decrease from the request level.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: I urge my colleagues to support the FY22 Omnibus Appropriations bill. This bill provides $782 billion for the Department of Defense and for other defense functions – nearly $42 billion more than FY21.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: As political compromise has become more and more difficult, great credit belongs to Appropriations Chairman @SenatorLeahy for making the tough choices that needed to be made to reach an agreement.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: The FY22 appropriations package represents a massive bipartisan effort that rests upon a framework that preserves all legacy riders, rejects poison pill policy provisions from both sides, and achieves dollar-for-dollar funding parity for defense and non-defense increases.

name: Richard Shelby

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text:
I am disappointed that we were blocked at every turn from engaging and passing real COVID relief in a bipartisan, targeted manner, just like the Senate did five times last year.
https://t.co/PCUwhz0CR8

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: The bill does nothing to get kids back in classrooms and, instead, includes a massive cash bailout for some mismanaged states and local governments. This is unacceptable.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Not only does it cost American taxpayers over a trillion dollars, but only 9% of the funding in the bill goes toward the immediate fight against COVID and 1% toward vaccines. Dems are forcing a liberal wish list of pet projects through Congress that's masked as a rescue package.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text:
Today I voted against the Dems' $1.9 trillion COVID bill for several reasons. This legislation includes a host of non-COVID-related left-wing policies and could further wreck the economy and ignite inflation. 
https://t.co/PCUwhz0CR8

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: These @AlabamaFTBL athletes & coaches demonstrated tremendous fortitude, ending the season 13-0. The team went 11-0 in conference play, becoming the first team in college football history to win 11 @SEC games in a season, & averaged 48.5 points per game – the most in SEC history.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: The Senate has passed my resolution commending the @UofAlabama Crimson Tide on winning the 2021 @NCAA College Football Nat'l Championship – the 18th Nat'l Championship for @AlabamaFTBL, and 6th in the last 11 years. I’m proud to formally recognize this achievement. #RollTide https://t.co/xnYt50KVNq

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Last year, the Senate worked together 5 times to pass bipartisan, targeted COVID relief to help combat the pandemic and get Americans' lives back to normal. This year, Democrats are pushing a partisan $1.9 trillion package filled with unrelated, self-serving liberal priorities.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: This COVID relief package is partisan & non-targeted. In fact, 90% of Dems’ COVID relief package is unrelated to COVID. Instead, Democrats want to expand Obamacare subsidies, push harmful economic policies, & fund blue state bailouts, Planned Parenthood, union pensions, & more.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: In Democrats’ massive $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package, very little is actually related to the pandemic. In fact, less than 9% of Democrats’ proposal would go to the core healthcare fight against COVID-19, and less than 1% deals with vaccinations.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Last year, Congress appropriated $68 billion in COVID-related funds for K-12 schools. Of that, only $5 billion has been spent. Schools have the resources to reopen and science has shown that it's safe to do so with simple precautions that we can accomplish right now.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: George Shultz was a great statesman. He held four cabinet positions and served under three different presidents. He was smart and wise, and dedicated his life to our country. We will miss his rational mind.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Congratulations to Ann Berry, the new Secretary of the Senate. Ann is a Birmingham native and the first African American and Alabamian to serve in this role. Having worked in the Senate for 40 years, she is well respected and will continue to be an asset in her new position.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Cosponsored a resolution, which just passed in the Senate, honoring the life and legacy of Hank Aaron for his vast accomplishments. The Mobile native was an impressive athlete and continues to be a role model to many. He earned his place in history and deserves this recognition.

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Secretary Austin and I also discussed my belief that robust investments in readiness and modernization are essential to maintaining a world-renowned military. We live in a troubled world. The defense of our nation must be our number one priority. @DeptofDefense 2/2

name: Richard Shelby
tweet_text: Today I spoke with @SecDef Lloyd Austin and reiterated my hope that the Biden Administration’s top priority will be the security of our nation. I told him that we must have the best trained, best led, and best equipped military in the world. 1/2
